page.title: 08Farming around Culcheth
page.content: Rowe Farm near to Culcheth is a farm which is typical of this area. The animals which are kept there are ponies, cows, bulls, dogs, turkeys, chickens and ducks. The cows, turkeys and chickens are kept for meat and the dogs are kept as pets. The ducks are kept for the eggs. The crops which they grow are barley and hay. They grow these crops because the hay is needed for the ponies and the barley is for the cattle. One of the main jobs on the farm is beef cattle, although there are other jobs carried out. These jobs are mucking out the farm, field work and feeding the animals. Tractors, trailers, mowing machines, bailers, combine harvesters, corn drills and cattle wagons are all used on the farm.
